name: GET_DescribeVpnGateways
description:
Describes one or more of your virtual private gateways.

For more information, see Amazon Web Services Site-to-Site VPN in the Amazon Web Services Site-to-Site VPN User Guide.

Filter.description:
One or more filters.

  • amazon-side-asn - The Autonomous System Number (ASN) for the Amazon side of the gateway.

  • attachment.state - The current state of the attachment between the gateway and the VPC (attaching | attached | detaching | detached).

  • attachment.vpc-id - The ID of an attached VPC.

  • availability-zone - The Availability Zone for the virtual private gateway (if applicable).

  • state - The state of the virtual private gateway (pending | available | deleting | deleted).

  • tag:<key> - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value.

  • tag-key - The key of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources assigned a tag with a specific key, regardless of the tag value.

  • type - The type of virtual private gateway. Currently the only supported type is ipsec.1.

  • vpn-gateway-id - The ID of the virtual private gateway.

VpnGatewayId.description:
One or more virtual private gateway IDs.

Default: Describes all your virtual private gateways.

DryRun.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

allOf.description: The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive.

The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values.

Filter.description:
A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs.

If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters.
